{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which induction anaesthetic agent has antiemetic effect, we need to review the relevant documents. Document [2] states that propofol, when compared to thiopentone for induction of anaesthesia, resulted in an 18% reduction in postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV). Document [18] also mentions that the antiemetic effect of propofol was considerable in the early postoperative period. However, there is no specific mention of etomidate or ketamine having antiemetic effects in the provided documents. Therefore, based on the available information, the correct answer is B. propofol.", "answer_choice": "B"}
